kana.name: Tofugu Hiragana Guide
kana.description: Uses mneumonics to teach Hiragana in a matter of hours.

kana.name: Tofugu Katakana Guide
kana.description: The same method of mneumonics but for Katakana.

kana.name: Hiragana Drag and Drop
kana.description: Good hands-on practice as you learn each row of the table (uses Flash).

kana.name: Hiragana Flashcards
kana.description: Another self-paced drill, recommend enabling all fonts in 'extras' for more reading practice.

kanji.name: WaniKani
kanji.description: Teaches 2,000+ Kanji via SRS. First 3-levels are free, also reinforces with 6,000 vocab.

kanji.name: KaniWani
kanji.description: Pairs with WaniKani, enforces recall of Kanji/Vocab rather than solely recognition.

kanji.name: Kanji Alive Radical Guide
kanji.description: Teaches the Kanji radicals (building blocks) and how their placement applies to craft Kanji.

kanji.name: KameSame
kanji.description: An alternate recall app, but also targets specific lists like N5 and covers much more than WaniKani.

kanji.name: Remembering the Kanji (Book)
kanji.description: Teaches the meaning and writing of Kanji only (but well). Does not teach the readings (how to pronounce).

vocab.name: Anki
vocab.description: A commonly used SRS tool where you can create or import a flashcard deck for personal studying.

vocab.name: Glenn Sun Vocab Test
vocab.description: A vocabulary exam tool that helps determine your current level of knowlege.

grammar.name: BunPro
grammar.description: Teaches vocabulary via SRS with paths that follow other guides like Tae Kim and Genki.

grammar.name: Don's Conjugation Drill
grammar.description: Practice your ability to conjugate any type of verb or adjective in modern Japanese.

grammar.name: Organic Japanese
grammar.description: Teaches logical roots and structure of Japanese in a way that ignores conventional English textbook teaching.

grammar.name: Tae Kim's Guide to Japanese
grammar.description: Incredible guide, but hard without a foundation in vocab. Recommend only the Grammar guide.

grammar.name: Genki I (2nd ed.) (Textbook)
grammar.description: The go-to textbook for schools, comes with audio files. No answer key (see next resource).

grammar.name: Genki Study Resources
grammar.description: This site hosts all of the Genkin textbook/workbook exercises for you to do in your browser.

grammar.name: Tofugu Verbs Article
grammar.description: Deep dive into the use of transitive versus intransitive verbs.

grammar.name: Human Japanese
grammar.description: A well-rounded book application that teaches kana, vocab, and grammar from square one.

reading.name: Tadoku Graded Readers
reading.description: Stories in native Japanese at various levels. Graded readers one of the best self-evaluation tools available.

reading.name: NHK News Easy
reading.description: Japanese news website written at the elementary/middle school level (N4-N3).

reading.name: NHK News
reading.description: The standard NHK news website not targeted to any specific level (N3-N2).

reading.name: Watanoc
reading.description: More news articles written specifically to a JLPT reading level. Has content for N5 learners.

reading.name: Crystal Hunters Manga
reading.description: Free manga written expressly for N5 learners, requires knowledge of only 87 words.

reading.name: Duendecat
reading.description: Contextual-based example sentences, based on WaniKani's leveling system; still useful for all.

reading.name: Satori Reader
reading.description: Curated content for various reading levels. A bit more advanced, but adjustable for growing learners.

reading.name: White Rabbit Graded Readers
reading.description: Native content and stories and specifically targeted reading levels. Readers are amazing, but expensive.

listening.name: Animelon
listening.description: Watch anime with Japanese subtitles and tools to assist as you watch. Polar Bear Caf√© recommended.

listening.name: JapanesePod101
listening.description: Lots of sample dialog podcasts that teach a small set of grammar and vocab in twenty minute bursts.

listening.name: ANJ Sub
listening.description: An alternative website to Animelon that provides Japanese subtitles that you can follow along.

media.name: Organic Japanese
media.description: Cure Dolly's official YouTube channel that teaches Japanese in a structured, logical way. Highly recommend.

media.name: Game Grammar YouTube
media.description: Let's Plays to teach Japanese, has Japanese 101 lessons that offer unique takes on grammar teaching.

media.name: Game Grammar Twitch
media.description: Ask questions during the let's plays and grammar lessons live, VODs are uploaded right to YouTube.

media.name: Japanese Ammo
media.description: Useful for conversational Japanese and teaches a lot of dialect and nuance.

media.name: JapaNews
media.description: Japanese news livestream that loops every fifteen minutes.

media.name: JapanesePod101
media.description: The podcast site also hosts a live YouTube channel and various video resources for free.

jisho.name: Lorenzi's Jisho
jisho.description: Dictionary with some useful tagging and analytics.

jisho.name: Nihon Shock Cheat Sheets
jisho.description: Basic Japanese cheat sheets that you can print. I keep a printed copy on my desk.

jisho.name: Google Translate
jisho.description: Inaccurate, useful for simple translations. Struggles with English to Japanese, use a dictionary.

culture.name: KemushiChan
culture.description: Vlog from a non-native speaker who lives and works in Japan.

culture.name: All Japanese All The Time
culture.description: Fun blog for a bit of inspiration and tips on immersing yourself in the language. Don't read too much into it.

jlpt.name: JLPT Official Site
jlpt.description: Offical website for the JLPT. Purchase official study materials there as well.

jlpt.name: AATJ
jlpt.description: American Association of Teachers of Japanese hosts the JLPT in the United States. Sign up for the test here.

jlpt.name: Learning Kanji
jlpt.description: A native Japanese speaker reviews official JLPT tests and explains the questions and answers.

unevaluated.name: Koohi
unevaluated.description: Teaches vocabulary present in various media using SRS.

unevaluated.name: Ryou
unevaluated.description: Flashcard SRS with a nice user interface. Can target specific JLPT sections.

unevaluated.name: HelloTalk
unevaluated.description: Talk to native Japanese speakers. You correct their English, they correct your Japanese.

unevaluated.name: Team Japanese
unevaluated.description: Provides a list of websites that (supposedly) provide free reading material for learners.

unevaluated.name: Maggie Sensei
unevaluated.description: Grammatical resource that provides a number of quality examples nail down grammatical concepts.

unevaluated.name: Aedict Online
unevaluated.description: Online Jisho with stroke order and translation capabilities.

unevaluated.name: Flo*Flo
unevaluated.description: Search for manga and books and pull down vocabulary lists sorted by frequency in the books that you read.

unevaluated.name: Steven Kraft's Projects
unevaluated.description: Another conjugation drill website, with drills for counters and Kanji. Also has a few cheat sheets.
